Has there always been Tundra near the KSC? Seems a bit strange, considering it's on the equator...

![dUi6S9y.png](http://i.imgur.com/dUi6S9y.png)
I have noticed this as well. Very strange, but at least you get free science :-)
From the definition of tundra I have in memory this is very strange indeed.

I think it has something to do with how the biome maps were made. You get a lot of small patches of Tundra wherever Grasslands meet Shores.

Not as bad as Mun though. most of the crates are ringed with a random biome

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-23T14:21:29Z" title="05/23/2015 02:21  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 23, 2015</time> by Rhomphaia**

I haven't checked the immediate surroundings, but imho this could be the interpolation bug regarding biome maps. Close to the border between two biomes KSP behaves strange, as the biomes are "colour coded" (sorry, I don't have game development experience, no idea how it's called properly), and KSP smooths out the sharp edges when upscaling the biome maps. If now the interpolated "colour" is closer to the "colour" of a non-adjacent biome than to both adjacent biomes, it leads to the observed inconsistency.

> 
> I haven't checked the immediate surroundings, but imho this could be the interpolation bug regarding biome maps. Close to the border between two biomes KSP behaves strange, as the biomes are "colour coded" (sorry, I don't have game development experience, no idea how it's called properly), and KSP smooths out the sharp edges when upscaling the biome maps. If now the interpolated "colour" is closer to the "colour" of a non-adjacent biome than to both adjacent biomes, it leads to the observed inconsistency.

It's called a [vector](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vector_space). It's more graphic art than development.

This is a very old bug. It has been around since they added biomes.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-23T14:30:45Z" title="05/23/2015 02:30  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 23, 2015</time> by Alshain**
I got "Poles" science from the mun's equator this way ... ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
I found poles and poles crater near the equator on minmus
Huh. Good to know. Next time I won't go so far out of the way for my biome science!
This is one of those things that should have been cleansed before release.

Its hardly a game breaking bug... its something exploitable... but come on... its a kerbin biome... there's already enough to exploit just at KSC.

And as for other celestial bodies? you don't really have much of a chance of finding those weird border biomes unless you are roving along, so its a reason to use rovers ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Its so minor, I don't blame them for not fixing it, when they had so much else to do.
This is a so very important biome as the science it provides gives a boost when playing on extreme hard. Think of it as treasure hunting and when found brings that feeling of fortune.

> 
> I found poles and poles crater near the equator on minmus

There is a spot on Kerbin, near the inland lake around (-27 +80) where you can find inside a 1km walk:

water

shore

tundra

grassland

highland

mountain.

Similarly, on Mun in the Twin Crater region, you can find

Twin Crater

Midlands

North West Crater

Poles

Polar Lowlands

all within 1 easy RCS-EVA range of each other.

Who ever said biomes make sense?

Yeah, the biome maps have been a mess in this way pretty much since they were added to the game.

I've been considering trying to setup a system to filter them and convert to more reasonable values based on longitude and latitude to at least get rid of some of the sillier ones like tundra and Munar poles near the equator and such. Those ones in particular are a shame as they're a big motivation towards putting things in polar orbits rather than just equatorial all the time.
